content:
Hola, Las versiones portables no son oficiales. El Thunderbird 127 era una versión Beta actualmente esta en la versión 128, pero según el calendario de release de Thunderbird la versión 127 no se lanzara como estable, en su lugar será la versión 128 ESR: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2024/06/may-2024-community-office-hours-the-thunderbird-release-process/

Si se ha resuelto la consulta agradeceríamos marcar como solucionada para que sirva a otros usuarios. ¡Gracias!
creator: pcp04

content: How is the crash behavior different from a freeze?
creator: wsmwk

content:
After the crash Thunderbird is not running annymore. There is no active process after a crash. During a freeze Thunderbird is not responsive.

Sometime Thunderbird recovers from a freeze and sometimes it crashes and stops the process.

content: I doubt anyone will offer ideas unless you post the error messages and a screenshot of the incoming server settings.
creator: davidsk

content:
enter mailnews.default_view_flags and change value to 0.

This means any Newly created folder does not have threading auto created on that new folder. Are you saying you created a new folder and it auto had threading enabled ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Are you trying to remove the option 'threading' ? If yes: Basically set up what you do want in the Inbox and then apply the sort to all folders inthe mail account.

1. Select 'Inbox' folder of mail account.

2. Set up the sort view you want to see.

  • 'View' > 'Sort by' and choose 'Date' and 'Descending' and 'Unthreaded'

3. Apply the sort view to all folders in the mail account:

  • Hover over 'Apply current view to'
  • Hover over 'Folders and it's children'
  • hover over the 'mail account name' - not a folder
  • finally click on the 'mail account name' not a folder.

You would need to repeat the above for each mail account.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: I was trying to setup my inboxes so that when I open an email I see not only that new email but both Reply and Sent threads under it. Eventually the whole conversation without opening past emails. Someone on here said changing mailnews.default_view_flags and change value to 0, would do it.
creator: ies1

content:
If you have switched off threading as per instructions.... If you sent an email to a friend and they used 'Reply' to respond back then the reply you receive would have the original email below it.

However, that does depend upon whether the person responding chose to include the original message in their reply or not. You have no control over what they choose to do.

For example Thunderbird offers you that option: In Account Settings Select 'Composition & Addressing' As you can see there is an option to 'automatically quote the original message when replying' which if you uncheck does not include it in the email.

Many people do not include it because it makes the email bloated if a load of comments are still included. It can also be a pain if people start using 'Reply' because it auto adds the email address, but in reality they are now talking about an entirely different topic. So they switch off the auto include and edit the subject as they may feel it saves them from looking up the email address.

If you then used 'Reply' to respond back then you should also see the left pointing icon to indicate you replied but obviously that email will be in the 'sent' folder.

One option: A right click on email in list and select 'Open message in Conversation' This will open in a new tab and list all emails both received and sent connected to that email. The emails are separate which is not what you were looking for, but it does contain received and sent.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
By default this is the current auto set up.

All default folders are listed first and usually in the following order:

  1. Inbox
  2. Drafts
  3. Templates
  4. Sent
  5. Archives
  6. Junk/Spam
  7. Deleted/Trash

All folders you create will be listed after the default folders and they will be in alphabetical order A - Z. All subfolders follow the same A-Z within folder.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Not sure if this effects you, but this was info off the spectrum website:

Note: Spectrum Business customers with an email address ending in @bresnan.net should refer to a recent email notification from us detailing important changes, including how to save email and contacts in advance of the changes occurring on March 6, 2024. Questions? Call (800) 314-7195.

The part which comes after the '@' in your email address determines which server settings you should be using.

It would be helpful if you could tell us what comes after the '@'. Also provide info on current server settings: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll to 'Mail and News Accounts' section.
  • Copy all the data in that section and paste into this forum question.

Useful link: https://www.spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-server-settings
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Before moving, make sure that both machines are using the same version of thunderbird. Next, give explicit details of how you copied profile. For one, copying while thunderbird is running guarantees failure.
creator: davidsk

content: My suggestion is this - in the version you use, click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to profile folder', click 'open folder' - check to verify where the folder is. I presume it is at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird - exit thunderbird and copy the 'thunderbird folder else where for safety - DO THIS AFTER exiting thunderbird - now uninstall both version. if prompted to removed data, do NOT - now install the preferred version. it should start with the right profile. if not, exit thunderbird, and then copy the backup of the thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overlay what is there - start thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks for the reply, David. I should have added to my original post that I store my Thunderbird emails on a different physical drive (D:), which is a regular hard drive, while the program itself (along with Windows and all my other programs) is stored on an SSD (C:). I set it up that way to make data backups easier since all data is on the hard drive (D:). I also wanted to reduce wear and tear on the SSD from constantly downloading emails to that drive.

What I didn't fully appreciate is that Thunderbird *really* seems to want my profile on the C: drive.

I have deleted both Thunderbird programs and installed the current version from the TB website. The problem I'm having now is trying to get TB to connect with my profile on the hard drive. When I set that profile as the default and try to use it, I get this pop-up:
creator: adlerkralle

content:
Ok, that 'sounds like' you had been using a beta version in one of the other two and that may have been a factor in running two copies. Try this official way to revert to an older version: 

Exit Thunderbird if running.    click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

If that doesn't work, there is a dirtier way, but try the official approach first.
creator: davidsk

content:
Success!

I assume I can click on Help|About and upgrade Thunderbird now?

I'm not sure which version I'm running now.
creator: adlerkralle

content: YES. free beer for all. to see your version prior to clicking help>about, click settings>general and scroll down to UPDATES and click 'update history'. If it shows a beta, let's start over. Otherwise, continue with help>about and upgrade. :)
creator: davidsk

content:
It looks like I have the latest version (115.12.2) without having knowingly updated.

Go figure.

All I know is I got my emails back along with all my extensions and folders. I'm happy.

Thanks again, David!
creator: adlerkralle

content: You are most welcome. This all gave me a smile. Well worth the effort. :)
creator: davidsk

content:
What's odd is that after the new install, when I went to Settings|General and scrolled down to Updates, it showed the latest version 115.12.2. When I clicked on Update History, however, it showed only version 127.0 installed at 10:14 this morning (which was before the uninstalls and reinstall). When I went to Help and About, it also showed the latest version. Maybe it shows only the last update before the current version?

BTW, I *never* use beta versions for *any* programs. I'd love to know how this whole mess even happened.

Eh, anyway, it all seems to be working.
creator: adlerkralle

content: For one thing, you installed 127.0, which was never an official download and is a beta that was not intended for use. I'm glad all is working. I encourage you to revisit whether you have other software on your PC that is attempting to keep your PC up-to-date. Thunderbird would never have downloaded 127.0, but other products that advertise the ability to update software might do that.
creator: davidsk

content:
Looking at the Internet now, I see that versions 125 and 127 are both betas, which makes sense since the numbers are higher than for the current version. As for how they got on my machine, I think you hit on something there with your mention of update software. I've been using Patch My PC for years to keep all my programs updated. AFAIK, this program does not download beta software.

To avoid any problems in the future, I opted to disable scanning for updates for Thunderbird in Patch My PC.
creator: adlerkralle

content: I think I got version 127 from clicking on the older second Thunderbird executable just to find out what the version number was. It said 125 at first but likely updated during the session. That still leaves the question—how did I get version 125? ;)
creator: adlerkralle

content:
re :The list I get when I LEFT click is pretty much entirely different: Undo, cut, copy, paste, delete, and select all are all options

Right click on the mailing list name to see drop down like image previously supplied then left click on 'Expand List' option and the mailing list name should be replaced by all the individual email addresses. Then you select/highlight the unwanted email address - right click on it to see drop down options and click on delete. That email address gets removed from the list. Repeat as required to remove email address from that email.

However, you need to be aware that as all email addresses are now visible in a TO field, it does mean everyone who receives that email will see all the email addresses. This may be ok, but do all those contacts mind you sharing their personal information?
